text: The Highland Towers collapse happened on 11 December 1993 in Taman Hillview, Ulu Klang, Selangor, Malaysia. Block 1 fell due to a landslide caused by heavy rain, killing 48 people. The complex had three 12-storey buildings, built between 1974 and 1982. The other two blocks were evacuated. On 11 December 2004, former residents and victims gathered at the site for a final farewell. Siti Hasmah Mohamad Ali, the wife of former Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad, also attended. ==References== Category:Disasters in buildings and structures Category:1990s disasters in Asia Category:1993 disasters Category:20th century in Malaysia
title: Highland Towers collapse
